docs.snippet: The Oscar nominations will be handed out Tuesday beginning at 8:30 a.m., Eastern. The Bagger takes a trip through everyone's predictions before the big day....
docs.lead_paragraph: With less than 12 hours to go until the Bagger tames her bedhead for the Oscar nomination announcement, let's take a trip through everybody's final predictions. Guess what? They're almost all the same!
docs.abstract: The Oscar nominations will be handed out Tuesday beginning at 8:30 a.m., Eastern. The Bagger takes a trip through everyone's predictions before the big day.

docs.snippet: Even in an industry in which multiarmed back-patting is the cost of doing business, Kathryn Bigelow, the director of "The Hurt Locker," seems to have an unusual level of support from her presumptive co-nominees....
docs.lead_paragraph: Since the Directors Guild anointed her with its top prize on Saturday, Kathryn Bigelow has become the frontrunner in the best director sprint. Even in an industry in which multiarmed back-patting is the cost of doing business, Ms. Bigelow seems to have an unusual level of support from her presumptive co-nominees.
docs.abstract: Even in an industry in which multiarmed back-patting is the cost of doing business, Kathryn Bigelow, the director of "The Hurt Locker," seems to have an unusual level of support from her presumptive co-nominees.

docs.snippet: Jason Reitman, deep in the awards race with "Up in the Air," has an idiosyncratic way of deciding what he is going to direct....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jason Reitman, an early man to beat in the Oscar race, appeared on "The Oprah Winfrey Show" recently, during which she urged people to see his film "Up in the Air." (Lee Daniels, the director of "Precious: Based on the Novel 'Push' by Sapphire," of which Oprah is an executive producer, groused good-naturedly about this at the Directors Guild Awards. "Oprah, who is my executive producer, says you gotta go out and see his movie?" he said from the stage. "Oprah Winfrey, executive-produce him.")
docs.abstract: Jason Reitman, deep in the awards race with "Up in the Air," has an idiosyncratic way of deciding what he is going to direct.

docs.snippet: The founder of the Razzies says 2009 was such a good year for bad movies that he was tempted to double the number of nominees, just like the Oscars....
docs.lead_paragraph: In the interest of fair and balanced reporting, let's step away from shiny gold statuary for a moment. The Razzies, which honor (dishonor?) the worst of movies, have announced their nominations, and as the Gold Derby blog points out, Sandra Bullock could become the first actress in history to score a Razzie (for "All About Steve") and an Oscar in the same year ("The Blind Side").
docs.abstract: The founder of the Razzies says 2009 was such a good year for bad movies that he was tempted to double the number of nominees, just like the Oscars.

docs.snippet: An Italian judge said the Italian secret services were most likely aware of, “and perhaps complicit in,” the abduction of an Egyptian cleric from the streets of Milan in 2003....
docs.lead_paragraph: An Italian judge said the Italian secret services were most likely aware of, “and perhaps complicit in,” the abduction of an Egyptian cleric from the streets of Milan in 2003.

headline.main: Judge Ties Italy Secret Service to Cleric’s Abduction
headline.print_headline: Judge Links Italy Agency To Abduction Of a Cleric

docs.snippet: Has the Oscar horse race developed a leader of the herd? On Saturday the Directors Guild of America awarded its top prize to Kathryn Bigelow for “The Hurt Locker,” the Iraq war drama that also took the best film honors from the Producers Guild...
docs.lead_paragraph: Has the Oscar horse race developed a leader of the herd? On Saturday the Directors Guild of America awarded its top prize to Kathryn Bigelow for “The Hurt Locker,” the Iraq war drama that also took the best film honors from the Producers Guild a week before.

headline.sub: Deep Debt Forcing Pasadena Playhouse to Close ;

docs.snippet: At the very loose Directors Guild Awards on Saturday, filmmakers gave risque shout-outs to one another while attendees wondered what Kathryn Bigelow's victory meant for the Oscars....
docs.lead_paragraph: "Your movie is as beautiful as your legs," Lee Daniels told Kathryn Bigelow, the evening's big winner, while up on the podium Saturday night at the Directors Guild Awards. "You make me question my sexuality." Mr. Daniels, the director of "Precious: Based on the Novel 'Push' by Sapphire," also noted that he was wearing Spanx, to the delight of the women in the room.
docs.abstract: At the very loose Directors Guild Awards on Saturday, filmmakers gave risque shout-outs to one another while attendees wondered what Kathryn Bigelow's victory meant for the Oscars.

docs.snippet: The Directors Guild winner has gone on to win the best-picture Oscar in 54 of 60 years, so awards pundits immediately began predicting that Kathryn Bigelow would become the first female director to win an Oscar, or possibly two....
docs.lead_paragraph: Has the Oscar horse race developed a leader of the herd? On Saturday, the Directors Guild of America awarded its top prize to Kathryn Bigelow for helming "The Hurt Locker," the Iraq war drama that also took the best-film honors from the Producers Guild a week before. So "Avatar" may no longer be the the film to beat this season.
docs.abstract: The Directors Guild winner has gone on to win the best-picture Oscar in 54 of 60 years, so awards pundits immediately began predicting that Kathryn Bigelow would become the first female director to win an Oscar, or possibly two.

docs.snippet: Film     This is the time of year when the foreign-language Oscar offerings start showing up in American art houses as they try to generate buzz. Israel's entry, the much talked about ''Ajami,'' begins a two-week run on Wednesday at Film Forum in ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Film This is the time of year when the foreign-language Oscar offerings start showing up in American art houses as they try to generate buzz. Israel's entry, the much talked about ''Ajami,'' begins a two-week run on Wednesday at Film Forum in the South Village. Not far away, though, at the Angelika Film Center in Greenwich Village, the Danish contender will also be making some noise in a run that begins on Friday.
